newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks mostly firmer in London.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks mostly firmer in London.

text.p: Most Japanese stocks were higher in London on Friday, underpinned by strength in shares in major exporters and banks, dealers said.
At 1513 GMT, the Nikkei 50 was up 13.61 points at 1,413.51.
Shares in blue chip exporting concerns like Sony Corp and Toyota Motor Corp, firmed as the dollar appreciated against the Japanese yen, making Japanese exports more competitive on work markets.
The dollar rose as high as 122.12 against the yen in New York after the U.S. jobs data were released.

Dealers said most bank shares got a boost in London after Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd said it would dispose of 550 billion yen worth of problem loans. The bank made the announcement after Tokyo markets closed.
"Banks have been under pressure in the last few months and now it looks like they're prepared to take measures to get their houses in order," said one dealer.
He said he expected Japanese stocks to rise on Monday, led by shares in exporters, banks and property companies.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 average closed 157.41 points higher at 18,198.74, having dipped below the 18,000 level at one point in the session.
Dealers viewed the close above the 18,000 level as a bullish signal.
